directive: We need to work on improving the docs and landing page with important feature we added related to sandboxing. issues.title: Define unified sandboxing messaging and content map
issues.body:
## Summary
Create a single source of truth for how sandboxing is described across marketing and technical docs, with explicit Claude + Codex parity in the unified Locus interface.

## Scope
- Inventory current landing page, docs, and README messaging related to sandboxing.
- Identify conflicting or missing statements about model support, Docker dependency, sync behavior, and secret protection.
- Produce a content map that assigns each topic to specific surfaces (landing, docs, README).

## Deliverables
- Messaging brief with approved terminology and key claims.
- Section-level mapping for where each sandboxing topic will live.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] A documented messaging brief exists and explicitly states sandboxing support for both Claude and Codex in one interface.
- [ ] The brief includes required topics: why sandboxing matters, Docker requirement, `.env` protection, `.sandboxignore`, and automatic synchronization.
- [ ] A publish plan maps each topic to exact file targets for landing page, docs, and README updates.

issues.title: Add high-visibility sandboxing section to landing page
issues.body:

issues.title: Create sandboxing setup docs with Docker-first workflow
issues.body:
## Summary
Publish end-to-end setup documentation for sandboxing, centered on Docker requirements and first-run experience across Claude and Codex.

## Scope
- Document prerequisites (Docker installation, daemon status, platform caveats).
- Provide step-by-step setup, verification, and troubleshooting.
- Explain how users choose Claude or Codex while using the same sandboxing layer.

## Deliverables
- New or updated sandbox setup guide in docs.
- Troubleshooting section for common Docker/sandbox startup failures.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Docs include a complete setup flow from prerequisites to successful sandbox run.
- [ ] Docker dependency is explicit, including how to verify Docker is available.
- [ ] Guide explains unified interface behavior when switching between Claude and Codex.
- [ ] Troubleshooting covers at least startup failure, permission issue, and sync issue cases.

issues.title: Document sandbox security model and secret/file protection
issues.body:
## Summary
Add dedicated security documentation for how sandboxing prevents sensitive data leakage, including `.env` handling and `.sandboxignore` behavior.

## Scope
- Explain threat model and default protections for local files and secrets.
- Document how `.env` files are excluded or protected from model exposure.
- Define `.sandboxignore` syntax, precedence, and practical examples.
- Clarify automatic synchronization boundaries (what syncs, when, and what is excluded).

## Deliverables
- Security-focused docs page or section.
- Copy-reviewed examples of safe/unsafe patterns and recommended defaults.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Docs explicitly state how `.env` and comparable secret files are protected from model context exposure.
- [ ] `.sandboxignore` usage includes examples for common secret/config directories.
- [ ] Automatic synchronization behavior is documented with inclusion/exclusion rules.
- [ ] Security guidance includes at least one best-practice checklist for teams.

issues.title: Run docs and landing consistency QA for sandboxing content
